abstract: Eddie Bauer‘s proposed buyout collapsed this week, and last year’s auction of Jones Apparel Group ended with no sale. Even so, analysts at Citigroup say that cash-rish private equity firms could still find many tempting takeover targets in the retail industry. Liz Claiborne was one company they said had the kind of strong cash flows and low debt levels that often get private equity firms’ attention. One of the least attractive targets, the analysts said, is Gap, whose weak sales and management turmoil have made it the subject of buyout speculation.
lead_paragraph: Eddie Bauer‘s proposed buyout collapsed this week, and last year’s auction of Jones Apparel Group ended with no sale. Even so, analysts at Citigroup say that cash-rish private equity firms could still find many tempting takeover targets in the retail industry. Liz Claiborne was one company they said had the kind of strong cash flows and low debt levels that often get private equity firms’ attention. One of the least attractive targets, the analysts said, is Gap, whose weak sales and management turmoil have made it the subject of buyout speculation.
